place.name: TEVERSAL
place.gazetteerText: TEVERSALL, a parish, with a village, in Mansfield district, Notts; 3 miles NW of Sutton r. station, and 3¾ W by N of Mansfield. Post town, Mansfield. Acres, 2,820. Real property, £2,850. Pop., 351. Houses, 65. The manor belongs to the Dowager-Countess of Carnarvon. There are sandstone quarries and a colliery. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £510.* Patron, the Dowager-Countess of Carnarvon. The church is partly Norman. Charities, £7. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
